tool_description: The Biteasy Blockchain REST API provides you with a convenient, powerful and simple way to read data from the bitcoin network and build your own services with it.
name: biteasy
title: biteasy

api_list.name: GET /blocks/{hash}
api_list.description: Returns information about a specifc block.

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The SHA-256 hash of the block that needs to be hash

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com/blocks/000000000000000c64a08fbe5fa23b4a87874195fbe95 e701276254afc6fca62"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com/blocks/{hash}"

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET /addresses
api_list.description: Returns an array of paginated addresses which can optionally be fltered.

optional_parameters.name: address[]
optional_parameters.description: An array of specific address values

optional_parameters.name: hash160[]
optional_parameters.description: An array of specific hash160 values

api_list.name: GET /transactions/{hash}
api_list.description: Returns information about a specifc transaction.

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The SHA-256 hash of the block that needs to be fetched

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com/transactions/c9a202ce6750c93a93112e30e2780176c87b452 714b5aaf8c545ba6892a97096"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET /addresses/{address}
api_list.description: Returns information about a specifc bitcoin address.

required_parameters.name: address
required_parameters.description: The address that needs to be fetched

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com/addresses/18k4dS2X9CTWuG4nWij6GgvWFzXXQp1whq"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com/addresses/{address}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-biteasy.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: GET /search
api_list.description: Auto-detects the type of the blockchain data that are requested and searches for them. Possible  values for the type feld in the response body are BLOCK, ADDRESS and TRANSACTION

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: The query string. It can be a block hash, block  height, transaction hash, address or a hash160

api_list.name: GET /blocks
api_list.description: Returns an array of paginated blocks which can optionally be filtered.

optional_parameters.name: solved_at
optional_parameters.description: The ISO-8601 date, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD (e.g.  2012-12-07), which the blocks were solved

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: (default: 1) The page offset that needs to be fetched

optional_parameters.name: per_page
optional_parameters.description: (default: 5) The number of blocks per page that needs to be  fetched

api_list.name: GET /transactions
api_list.description: Returns an array of paginated transactions which can optionally be fltered.

optional_parameters.name: address
optional_parameters.description: The incoming AND the outgoing address of the  transactions

optional_parameters.name: from_address
optional_parameters.description: The incoming address of the transactions

optional_parameters.name: to_address
optional_parameters.description: The outgoing address of the transactions

optional_parameters.name: block_hash
optional_parameters.description: The block SHA-256 hash which the transactions  must belong to

optional_parameters.name: confidence
optional_parameters.description: The confidence type of the transactions.  Allowed values are: BUILDING, DEAD, PENDING and  UNCONFIRMED

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: (default: 1) The page offset that needs to be fetched

optional_parameters.name: per_page
optional_parameters.description: (default: 20) The number of transactions per page that  needs to be fetched
